DOC.brief_summary: CP-675,206 is a fully human monoclonal antibody (mAb). It binds to the CTLA4 molecule, which is expressed on the surface of activated T lymphocytes. CP-675,206 is thought to stimulate patients' immune systems to attack their tumors. CP-675,206 is not expected to have a direct effect on tumor cells. CP-675,206 been shown to induce durable tumor responses in patients with metastatic melanoma in Phase 1 and Phase 2 clinical studies.
DOC.brief_title: Study of CP-675,206 in Refractory Melanoma
DOC.criteria: Surgically incurable Stage III or IV melanoma One prior systemic treatment for metastatic melanoma Measurable disease Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) PS = 0 or 1 Melanoma of ocular origin Received prior vaccine Received prior CTLA4inhibiting agent History of, or significant risk for, chronic inflammatory or autoimmune disease Potential requirement for systemic corticosteroids
